context: A suspicious service registration involving the executable `services.exe` was detected on a system, indicating possible malicious activities aimed at persistence or escalating privileges. Subsequent alerts identified additional suspicious behaviors, culminating in an alert where a host access a critical directory key.
question: Which host accessed the AD FS DKM key during the final alert?
solution_steps: A system program was registered as a service on host `mb-adfs`.
A renamed system executable `powershell.exe` was launched.
A process was injected with potentially malicious code by an account with SID `S-1-5-21-551436448-9871687716-9837441745-1903`.
Luciano Herrera (CIO) on MB-WINCLIENT sent a suspected DCSync attack replication request to host `MB-DC1`.
Host `MB-DC1` read the DKM key of the ADFS object with id `4cac49d3-29d3-407e-8c9b-b7ebb21541b2`.
